results.firPara: Liverpool will test a vulnerable and depleted Arsenal back line, Everton might not be ready for Spurs while Burnley begin another long battle for survival
results.secPara: There is something particularly dispiriting about entering a new season in the throes of an injury crisis. This, surely, is the moment when footballers should be at their physical peak, following a few weeks rest and a few further weeks of controlled muscle-buffing and tactic-honing. And yet, here we are. Per Mertesacker, injured in a friendly against Lens, and Gabriel Paulista, who failed to finish a warm-up game against Manchester City, will both be missing for a couple of months, and with Laurent Koscielny only just having returned from an extended post-European Championship summer break the only fully fit defenders are Calum Chambers – who has played 51 minutes of league football in 2016, across four games – and Rob Holding, a 20-year-old, £2m summer signing from Bolton Wanderers. The veracity of Francis Coquelins boast during pre-season that he had been playing centre-back and bossing it in training could get a very early test. This fixture has been pretty reliably entertaining for a while now – the goalless draw here last August was the first in 43 meetings between these sides, in which time there have been two 4-2s, a 4-0, a 4-1, a 4-4 and a 6-3 – and with Liverpools attack strengthened over the summer another stalemate would appear unlikely. SB
results.webTitle: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend
Football transfer rumours: ter Stegen to replace Joe Hart at Manchester City?

results.firPara: Guardian writers predicted position 14th (NB this is not necessarily Alan Smiths prediction but the average of our writers tips)
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 previews No19 West Bromwich Albion | Alan Smith

results.firPara: Claudio Ranieri has wasted no time in kickstarting the Premier League mind games by claiming it is more likely that ET comes to Piccadilly Circus than his Leicester City side retain their title.
results.secPara: Speaking in the buildup to the seasons opening match, the champions trip to Hull City on Saturday lunchtime, Ranieri was in characteristically gnomic form, insisting he expects the big clubs to return to form and that his sides first ambition is to avoid relegation.
results.webTitle: Claudio Ranieri: more chance of ET landing than Leicester retaining title

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has deprived himself of a convenient excuse should Liverpool fail to advance in his first full season in charge. This is my squad now, he said. This time it is my team. And this is not a manager who measures his team by signings alone.
results.secPara: A £70m-plus outlay on seven recruits plus 16 departures – and counting – represents another summer overhaul at Anfield. There were seven additions to Brendan Rodgers squad last summer and nine in 2014. Yet the likely starting XI at Arsenal on Sunday also reflects Klopps belief a team should not start from scratch but evolve and develop under his tutelage on the training ground. He was true to his word in giving Liverpools players every opportunity to prove themselves last season and a comparison with the managers first game in the Premier League 10 months ago, also in north London, demonstrates faith as well as areas where Klopp felt change was necessary.
results.webTitle: No excuses for Jürgen Klopp as he kicks off season with ‘his’ Liverpool team

results.firPara: • Spurs manager has finally gone over last seasons collapse with his team

results.webTitle: Mauricio Pochettino says he gave Tottenham players pre-season ‘rollicking’

results.firPara: Marquee players often deliver a promotional sugar hit, sometimes extraordinary performances, but rarely do they offer both
results.secPara: Its been rapturously greeted by just about every strata of Australian sport Tim Cahill, the prodigal son, our legend, our Timmy, has finally deemed the Australian domestic league worthy of his footballing presence. Whatever it was that the A-League didnt have in February, it has now. And even you cant help but read his statements in those monotone, UK-translated voices from bad Champions League magazine shows, hes saying the right things and were very lucky to have him, it seems.
results.webTitle: The curious case of Tim Cahill: a double-edged acquisition for the A-League | Sam Perry

results.firPara: Arsenal remain in negotiations with Valencia over their No1 central defensive target, Shkodran Mustafi, but there was no sign of an imminent breakthrough on Thursday night.
results.secPara: The temperature had been turned up earlier in the day when Ali Bulut, who has a connection to Mustafi, said that the 24-year-old Germany international had agreed terms with Arsenal and all that remained to be done was for the clubs to resolve the transfer fee.
results.webTitle: Arsenal in talks to buy Shkodran Mustafi from Valencia but deal not imminent

results.firPara: Odion Ighalo has signed a contract extension with Watford that commits the Nigeria striker to the club until 2021.
results.secPara: Ighalo, who scored 17 goals in 42 appearances last season, has been linked with a move away this summer. Watford turned down a £38m offer from the Chinese side Shanghai SIPG for the striker at the end of June with the owner, Giampaolo Pozzo, adamant that he is not considering selling the 27-year-old.
results.webTitle: Watford’s Odion Ighalo signs new contract to commit future until 2021
